docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's top lender Deutsche Bank is promoting two of its senior managers to deputy chief executives, complementing strategic adjustments and an 8 billion euro ($8.50 billion)capital raise.

headline.print_headline: Deutsche Bank Names Schenck, Sewing Co-Deputy Chief Executives
headline.main: Deutsche Bank Names Schenck, Sewing Co-Deputy Chief Executives

docs.lead_paragraph: Champions League contenders Bayer Leverkusen sacked coach Roger Schmidt on Sunday, a day after his team suffered their fourth loss in the last six league games with a 6-2 demolition by Borussia Dortmund.

headline.print_headline: Leverkusen Sack Coach Schmidt After Losing Run
headline.main: Leverkusen Sack Coach Schmidt After Losing Run

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in several states want to require driver's education courses to teach motorists about proper traffic-stop behavior. Most bills don't legislate what that behavior should be, but Illinois' 2017 "Rules of the Road" handbook published last month offers some do's and don'ts:

headline.print_headline: How to Act When Stopped by Police? Illinois Has Some Tips
headline.main: How to Act When Stopped by Police? Illinois Has Some Tips

docs.lead_paragraph: Harry Kane's superb scoring streak continued as Tottenham Hotspur survived some late nerves to beat Everton 3-2 at White Hart Lane on Sunday and cut Chelsea's lead at the top of the Premier League to seven points.

headline.print_headline: Unstoppable Kane Helps Tottenham to Cut Chelsea's Lead
headline.main: Unstoppable Kane Helps Tottenham to Cut Chelsea's Lead

docs.lead_paragraph: Deutsche Bank plans to raise capital, list its asset management business and overhaul its business structure as it tries to reinvent itself after spending two years dealing with its past misdeeds and huge losses.

headline.print_headline: Deutsche Bank to Raise 8 Billion Euros, Plans Major Reorganization
headline.main: Deutsche Bank to Raise 8 Billion Euros, Plans Major Reorganization

docs.lead_paragraph: Faced with the threat that Asian carp could enter the Great Lakes, Michigan is turning to the public for new ideas and plans to offer a prize to whoever comes up with a way to stop the voracious fish.

headline.print_headline: Michigan to Offer Prize in Fight Against Invasive Asian Carp
headline.main: Michigan to Offer Prize in Fight Against Invasive Asian Carp

docs.snippet: Faced with the threat that Asian carp could enter the Great Lakes, Michigan is turning to the public for new ideas and plans to offer a prize to whoever comes up with a way to stop the voracious fish....

docs.lead_paragraph: Iranian authorities have arrested an Iranian-American on charges of defrauding people seeking U.S. residence of $2.6 million, a  spokesman for the country's judiciary said on Sunday.

headline.main: Iran Holds Iranian-American on Fraud Charges: Judiciary
